New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player to hit 50 home runs and steal 50 bases in a single season
Shohei Ohtani broke Shawn Green's single-season franchise record for home runs with his 49th home run
Shohei Ohtani finished the game with 6 hits, 10 RBIs, and 2 stolen bases
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit 3 home runs and stole 2 bases in the game
Shohei Ohtani hit his 50th home run in the 7th inning
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers celebrated their 12th consecutive postseason berth
Shohei Ohtani thanked his teammates for their support
The Dodgers players expressed awe and admiration for Ohtani's performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers wore T-shirts honoring Ohtani's 50-50 feat
The game was played at loanDepot Park in Miami
Others: The Dodgers defeated the Miami Marlins 20-4
The game was a clinching game for the Dodgers' playoff berth
